citations.narrative:
* Containment fencing attached to the wood gate frame in three outdoor enclosures have become detached along the
side and bottom. Closer observation shows a one-to-two-inch gap forming between the fencing and wood gate frame. Six
cats are in contact with the affected fencing. Enclosure fencing shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals
from injury, escape and be able to contain the animals securely at all times. Not maintaining the fencing could have a
negative impact on the animals. The licensee must ensure housing facilities be kept in good repair, protect the animal
from injury and contain the animal securely. Correct by 10/10/24.

* A fecal waste accumulation was observed in three outdoor turf mats. Six cats are in contact with the affected turf mats.
The licensee stated that the waste was last removed about two weeks ago. Unsanitary conditions, potential odors, fly
infestation and disease hazards exist when fecal waste is not removed on a regular basis. This could potentially have a
negative impact on the cats. The licensee must provide for regular and frequent collection, removal and disposal of animal
wastes in a manner that minimizes contamination and disease risks. Correct by 10/3/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.1(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
* Containment fencing attached to the wood gate frame in three outdoor enclosures have become detached along the 
side and bottom. Closer observation shows a one-to-two-inch gap forming between the fencing and wood gate frame. Six 
cats are in contact with the affected fencing. Enclosure fencing shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals 
from injury, escape and be able to contain the animals securely at all times. Not maintaining the fencing could have a 
negative impact on the animals. The licensee must ensure housing facilities be kept in good repair, protect the animal 
from injury and contain the animal securely. Correct by 10/10/24. 
3.1(f) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
* A fecal waste accumulation was observed in three outdoor turf mats. Six cats are in contact with the affected turf mats. 
The licensee stated that the waste was last removed about two weeks ago. Unsanitary conditions, potential odors, fly 
infestation and disease hazards exist when fecal waste is not removed on a regular basis. This could potentially have a 
negative impact on the cats. The licensee must provide for regular and frequent collection, removal and disposal of animal 
wastes in a manner that minimizes contamination and disease risks. Correct by 10/3/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
